key_findings: Initial frameworks for scale diagrams (Angstroms to organisms) in biological quantum-to-classical transitions have been outlined.
Preliminary structures for documenting amplification mechanisms of quantum effects in biological systems (photosynthesis, navigation, enzymes, olfaction, DNA mutations) are in place.
Outlines for identifying critical transition points (driven by decoherence, temperature, scale) from quantum to classical behavior in biological phenomena have been created.
A conceptual model for information flow from quantum events to classical biological outcomes, covering origination, transduction, amplification, and integration, has been drafted.
next_priority: Detailed population of the created analysis documents (scale_diagrams.md, amplification_mechanisms.md, critical_transition_points.md, information_flow_model.md) with specific examples, data, and references from scientific literature.
